meanings.definition: The line of seaweed, debris, or trash left by the tide at the high-water mark on a beach.
meanings.sent1: At the beach, you can see the strandlines where the tide leaves seaweed and trash.
meanings.sent2: The children played near the strandlines, collecting shells and driftwood.
meanings.sent3: The seagull danced along the strandlines, looking for tasty treats.
meanings.sent4: The strandlines resembled a messy ribbon of nature's leftovers along the shore.
meanings.sent5: The strandlines painted a picture of the ocean's reach onto the sandy canvas.

meanings.definition: A line of stranded or washed-up objects or animals on a beach.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the beach was covered in various strandlines of debris.
meanings.sent2: The conservationists worked to clean up the strandlines to protect marine life.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the strandlines were a treasure map leading to hidden gems.
meanings.sent4: The strandlines of shells and seaweed created a unique pattern on the sand.
meanings.sent5: The strandlines told stories of the sea's offerings to the land.

meanings.definition: To leave or drive (a boat, sailor, or sea creature) aground on a shore.
meanings.sent1: The storm unexpectedly strandlines the fishing boat on the rocky shore.
meanings.sent2: The sailor's mistake caused him to strandlines his vessel on the sandy beach.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous mermaid decided to strandlines the unsuspecting sailors for fun.
meanings.sent4: The decision to strandlines the ship on purpose saved the crew from a bigger disaster.
meanings.sent5: The captain had to strandlines the damaged boat to prevent it from sinking.
